Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Exceptional photo prints, prints up to 17 inches by 22 inches, compact size
Cons: Wastes ink when switching from glossy to matte, finicky paper feed, expensive
Epson's least expensive professional photo printer, the Epson Stylus Pro 3880, can crank out prints up to 17 inches by 22 inches -- something that the lower-tier Canon Pixma Pro9000 Mark II and Canon Pixma Pro9500 Mark II can't do (they stop at 13 inches by 19 inches). The Epson also uses bigger ink tanks that reviews say cost less in the long run, and several computers can use this printer thanks to its Ethernet connectivity. ...

Upgraded from the epson 2200. I enjoy the larger print size and better print quality. Easy to set up and calibrate. colors are spot on and it's a joy to use.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact Design; Fast Print Time; Low Ink Consumption; Easy To Setup; Easy To Use
I have owned many Epson printers in the past. I always have my LCD's calibrated and it seemed they always printed to dark. So I had to do the ole duplicate layer, screen mode then drop opacity to about 30% to get them to match my screen... NOT ANYMORE!!!
Everything I have printed so far even on non Epson paper with 3rd party ICC profiles is printing perfect. So far no head clogs you read about with Epson, but I never really had that problem in the pst. I think that is climate based more so than technology based.
For a 17" printer it is pretty small (only about an inch longer than my 13" I had before it). It feeds and prints on everything i have tried so far. Even some Magic Lee 17" c ... anvas I have had for a while.
The colors and black and white prints will blow you away! If you are on the fence about buying this, then just do it, YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED! expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 4 out of 5 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We are using this printer exclusively for photo printing. I think it would be a waste to use it for routine text printing. We try to print 5 or 6 times per week. I have made 40 prints in the first week of using this printer. They have all been perfect from the very first one. I am letting Phtoshop CS5 manage colors except when in advanced black and white mode. You *must* have a calibrated display to make the most of this printer. When you do the printer will deliver what you see on your screen, and in most cases will improve on it. I strongly believe a print should be judged on its own merits and not simply by replication of the display. This printer recreates art if art is sent to it. Ink usage appears so far to be quite economical. I have used very little of the ink supply to produce t ... he first 40 prints, most of which were 8x10 with about 6 large format prints. If it doesn't run too many cleaning cycles (so far just one) I will be extremely pleased. I love the job log, which provides you with ink usage down to a fraction of a ml. In deciding to buy this printer I was impressed by the low ink cost on a per ml. basis. I have had no issues feeding it paper, either through the multi sheet tray, or the single sheet tray. It has fed both Epson and non-Epson paper perfectly. I cannot say enough about the superb quality of the prints the come out of the 3880. It conveys light and shadows with great and artistic accuracy, and colors are perfect. I was previously using an Epson R1800 which did produce very nice work, but this printer is a major and wonderful step up from that, with none of the paper feed issues or excessive cleaning cycles that drove me crazy with that printer. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I found the Epson 3880 very easy to set up and get running. I had some problems printing from iphoto, but found that this seems to be a long running problem with Apple and a number of other Epson printers. However, I was able to print from Photoshop. I was a little disappointed with the velvet paper, but maybe I just haven't found the right photo to print. I'll keep trying. The premium photo luster paper, however, looks great. The colors are perfect and the clarity has to be seen to be believed. I was also pleasantly surprised by how quickly a 16 x 20 photo was printed. I was expecting a much longer wait. It's a fairly large peripheral, but given the size of the prints, the footprint is reasonable. All in all, I am very happy with the 3880 and the price was well worth it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Once you get used to the control panel and have all your profiles, then printing becomes really rewarding. The image quality is amazing. The tonal range in both black and white and color prints brings your images to life. The 3880 can handle large print sizes up to 17 x 22. The print speed is good, not too slow and printer driver interface is relatively easy. The print quality is good for archival prints, museum quality prints and great for portfolio prints. It has a separate black and white setting for black and white photos and can handle a variety of paper thickness and types. I know you are waiting for the other shoe to drop. While the Epson 3880 has amazing fine art print quality, there a few little kinks that could be improved. For one, the front plate that folds up when not in u ... se is very delicate and does not fit tight. You have to be careful not to be too rough and break this panel. It does not take roll papers, only cut sizes. You will have send out for large pano prints. The inks are beautiful, all nine of them, but they are very expensive. You will not want to waste ink. In order to keep the jets from clogging, prints must be run through each week. It would not be a good to let the printer sit for long periods of time without printing. It does not come with a dust cover and needs one. It is heavy and large so you will need a nice big area to give it a home. Overall, I love this printer. It does everything and does it beautifully. It is a must have for any serious photographer. If you want to ensure you get the best color for your images, this printer will work for you. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Printer was ready to go right out of the box. No setup issues at all. I use a mac pro with snow leopard and found no conflicts. Ink was very easy to access and simple to load. Picked a file, sent to printer and had a photo that looked EXACTLY like my screen first try. Moving from an R2400 which has always done an excellent job, but the savings in ink alone make this a very smart investment. Add to that the ability to print 17 wide and have to pull the trigger on this. I know that the new models have extra ink and color, but at this price you really can't go wrong. It is also considerably lighter weight than it's replacement. I am an advanced amateur and do some events/weddings etc and will use this printer weekly. The paper size will allow for more creative print sizes and this w ... ill please me and my clients. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Setup; Easy To Use; Compact Design
Love it. Very compact so it doesn't take a lot of space.very crisp color prints but must use professional paper. I'm very pleased with black and whites.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Fast Print Time; Reliable; Easy To Setup
I had an Epson 2400 which I was very happy with. When a $300 rebate was offered I decided to buy it for the larger printing size. I was very impressed with the results. There was a noticeable improvement over the 2400. The larger ink tanks also are more cost effective. I'm very happy I made the switch.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Sorry I did not buy it sooner.
Item.Review: Advanced hobbyist that traded up from a problem free R1900. Prints are gorgeous with K3 inks, vibrant colors and details. Easy set up, follow simple Epson instructions. My monitor is color calibrated (IMac), prints match screen. Have not printed B&W yet but will shortly; all reviews indicate the 3880 provides excellent B&W prints. Initial cost of this printer and ink was higher than my previous printer but do the math and the 3880 is actually less expensive per ML of ink! To sum it up, great IQ that exceeded my expectations.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: For quite a while I used the HP B9180 printer largely because it allowed entirely self-designated sizes in borderless printing, and the quality was quite acceptable. But when that printer was discontinued, I started looking at the Epsons, which had the reputation as the line to buy. I'd marvelled at the sample prints I'd seen in flyers and at trade shows, and I looked forward to this step up. I have not been disappointed. That is not to say, however, that there has not been a period of learning how MY printer interacts with MY monitor/calibration/software. Colors were spot on from the start, but I have had to significantly ramp down the brightness and contrast on my monitor to reach a point where what's on my screen resembles what comes out of the Epson. Details are crisp, blacks deep, ... colors bright. I have used both the Epson papers and those from other makers, and as long as there are ICC profiles, the color results have been great. I particularly like the relatively small footprint of the printer given the largest paper size it can work with. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer exceeded all my photo printing performance expectations . The photo images are sharp and accurate. While the ink cartridges are a little pricey the price per volume is less than my previous printer. This printer is a must have for serious amateurs and professionals.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've had this printer two weeks and found it to be an outstanding printer. Originally, I was using an HP 7880 that I picked up when I purchased my 27 iMac Quad Core Computer. Initially, I had doubts about whether I should purchase a pro printer or take my prints to a photo lab for printing. Having tried the latter method, I was never happy with the large prints I've gotten back. Overall, there are a couple of things I really liked about the Epson 3880 printer right from the start. They are price, ease of setup, and quality of print. In terms of price, it was a no brainer. I paid [$] and Epson was offering a $300 mail in rebate. That brought the price down to [$]. On top of that, you get the nine ink cartridges (~$55 each) which is a value of $500 in ink. So the real price of the ... printer sans ink is $319. The other part of the equation is my HP cartridges hold about 10-14ml of ink. The 3880 hold 80ml of ink. I figure it will cost me about ~50% less to print on the 3880 . If you are thinking about one of the less expensive Epson printers (1990 or 2880), consider the size of the ink cartridges. The ink cartridges in these models hold less ink. This is was one of the decisive factors for me in selecting the 3880 over these two models. In terms of setup, it took very little time to setup and was very easy following the startup instructions. The most time consuming part was removing the tape and packing material. They do a very nice job protecting the printer in the box. I had already done a lot of reading about color management so it was easy for me to load the Ilford smooth pearl ICC profile onto my color sync folder in the library. I personally like the Ilford papers. I use Lightroom 3 and NIK software to process my photos. Bottom line: my color prints match perfectly what I see on my monitor and that's without any fancy monitor color calibration. I think this is in large part to Apple iMac computer. I can't say enough about the color prints and the black and whites I have printer out. The other feature I like is the ability to print anywhere from a 4x6 to 17x22 print and everything in between. I was limited to 8x10 on my HP. One other note: I highly recommend using the application to manage the color vice the printer. Just remember to turn color management off in the menu. Forgot this once or twice and wasted some paper! I double check this setting now before I go to print. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use; Compact Design; Durable construction; Fast Print Time
Cons: Large Footprint
Just set it up this weekend. It still has a large footprint for it's compact design, but much smaller than other large printers. I set it up on a lateral file cabinet which holds my supplies except large 17x22 paper. I printed out my first large prints and they look fantastic. I calibrated my 2011 iMac with a colormunki display and the prints were great. I am new to all this and wanted to start printing out my own photos as part of my new photography hobby I started last year. Definitely worth the money. As I said I'm new at this and they printed good.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer replaced an Epson R2400. While the R2400 was adequate for my needs, I wanted to eventually upgrade to the 17x22 size. The 3880 is quieter than the R2400, more cost effective for paper and ink and the prints are superb! The footprint is not all that much bigger either. I wish I had purchased this printer sooner!!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer after careful research and consulting with my photography club colleagues about the ones I was considering. This is my first photo printer. The printer was exceptionally well packed on arrival. Although I opened the bottom instead of the top due to the way it was packaged, it came out of the box without trouble. You do have to search for all of the taped and cardboard inserts to make sure they're all removed. A flashlight is helpful for this. The network setup was easy. Just follow the instructions in the order given and everything should work. So far I have printed only about 15 pictures--mostly 4 x 6. The first attempts were on some HP premium photo paper that I already had available. I was not happy with the color (I have a calibrated LCD monitor). So, ... a quick trip to a local store for Epson Premium Glossy provided improved results. The first picture I tried to print was a sunset photo with shades of purple to blue in the sky and white clouds. I think this was a bit more difficult to get just right. The second print was of a red car against green foliage background. This came out excellent. A couple of protraits were also excellent. I have made a few prints in 5x7 and 8.5x11. The large prints were on Epson Ultra Premium Luster paper. I really liked the way the darks and detail came out in this nighttime picture of an Amtrak train arriving at the station platform. Great printer so far. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We purchased this printer for our architectural firm for architectural photography. A few days after setup, we discovered it would not allow multiple sheets to be loaded. It would grab several at a time. When one sheet only was loaded, it misaligned the sheet, we got an error message and the printer shut down. One week after purchase, Epson sent us a refurbished replacement machine (not a new machine, mind you!). The refurbished machine at least does not misalign the sheets, but we still have to feed only one sheet at a time; you cannot let this printer run unattended, overnight, which was the reason we bought this printer. Furthermore, it does not allow use of roll paper. For a printer this size and cost one would expect roll handling. My 8-year-old Epson 2200 handles rolls, and I have ne ... ver had any of these problems with it. I guess they've really cheapened their quality in the past 8 years. When everything works, the print quality is wonderful. Ink cartridge costs are ridiculous, but at least they seem to last for a while. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have never used a printer of this quality and price range so I was a little hesitant about the purchase. I have always wanted a larger format printer. After I set it up on my apple computer and started doing some printing I was blown away at the ease of use and the quality of the results. I took some macro pictures(D3s&105mm mirco) of a 100 year old B/W photos(3x4) and printed them at 17x22(matt paper) - the result was stunning! This picture was a X-mas gift for my father in law, he started tearing up when saw his father standing next to his 1917 Chevy Model 490 in life like size. I also did some larger prints taken from jet cockpits years ago with much lower quality digital files. Again the results were impressive! I have never been inclinded to wite reviews but I am so happy wit ... h this purchase. As an amateur photographer this has opened up another area to share and use my love of photography. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Low Ink Consumption; Reliable; Easy To Use
Cons: Large Footprint
I print B&W large prints as well as color. This printer does a fantastic job and the ink consumption seems quite reasonable. Deep rich blacks with very nich gradation. No "muddy" shadow. Bright,true colors on both glossy and matte finishes.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: No more groaning at bad prints
Item.Review: I bought this to end frustration with non-pro printers for my photography and photographic art work, and to make bigger prints, without needing more space in my workroom. So far, it's exactly what I needed, and I'm sorry I waited so long. The gamut increase is very satisfying, the print quality is really outstanding, even on the large prints, and the function has been flawless. So far 6 or so prints each on 13 x 17 Epson Cold Press Natural, 17x22 Ultra Prem Presentation Matte, and 8 1/2x 11 Luster. No duds, no paper loss, and ink usage rate is barely perceptable. I'm still getting the feel of the different papers. I am finding soft proofing in PhotoShop using the included and downloaded ICC profiles to be helpful in making adjustments for different paper brightnesses and types, for exampl ... e, and have not felt the need to create custom profiles. It is a more attractive device than I expected. Easy to set up if you follow instructions carefully. I did update software from Epson website. I think the firmware didn't need updating. Shipping - well packed, no concerns. Minor issues: Feeding from the rear manual tray can be a bit tricky, but not insurmountable. You must remember to open the front panel and pull out cathc tray when starting a print. I wish it would detect that condition and alert me rather than feeding paper through anyway. I'm learning to batch matte and gloss print jobs as it does waste some of the two black inks when switching back and forth. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Setup; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Reliable
I love the ability to print 4x6 up to 16 x 20 or 17 x 24. The printer sits in the same space that the HP9180 used on my desk.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact Design; Reliable; Low Ink Consumption; No ink clogging
I purchased the 3880 to replace my R1800 in June, 2010. I discovered a major improvement in performance. With the R1800, I wasted a lot of ink in unclogging the cartridges. I've yet to have that same problem with the 3880. The quality of the prints is excellent. Plus, it's been close to a year, and I haven't had to replace not one cartridge! I estimate I'll replace the photo black by July.
My only small complaint is that it sometimes becomes finicky when feeding larger paper sizes.
I love the small footprint. I soley use it for Photoshop and Lightroom. I use my R320 to print everything else.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am a fine art photographer and use the printer to print scanned negatives and are teamed with digital images. The paper feed is easy to use and never jams. The image quality has been so amazing from the first print that I was blown away. The machine itself is a reasonable size to be used in a small space.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
I've been a long-time user of the R800, a printer which set a new standard when it came out.
In seeking a larger format printer I studied results, costs (especially cost of ownership), and ease of use.
I chose the 3880 and have not been disappointed. It takes up very little space. The results are excellent; most of my work is processed through Lightroom.
Although individual ink cartridges are pricey, their larger size makes them good value when compared to other printers.
Highly recommended for anyone who prints a reasonable volume of larger than letter sized prints, and who demands detail in colour or B&W.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: QI am using this printer to make a series of 13 x 19 inch prints of digitalized slides and digital photos in addition to everyday home printing needs. The 13x19 photos are excellent and print what I seen on the monitor unlike my old Epson 1280 which seemed to always print dark. Converting from the draft settings to photo settings takes a few minutes, a very long time in the computer world. We have been unable to integrate the printer into our Apple wireless network; whether my fault or the printer's, I don't know. But the printer does not seem to be wireless network friendly. The ink cartridge are not available in small cities; I have to order from online vendors. A few online retailers offer discounted prices, but those discount retailers I found don't carry all the different colors. ... In Southern Oregon it difficult to find a vendor that can make large, high quality prints from big, 50 plus MB, files. The Pro 3880 will give you exhibit quality prints at an affordable price plus handle routine printing chores. The above is based on three months use. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer to produce fine art color and B&W photographic prints. Prints from my 3880 exhibit higher image quality than I can obtain from regular photo labs, as well as higher image quality than any prior photo ink jet I've owned. More specifically, the prints have superior highlight and shadow detail; they never have 'muddy' shadows; they show considerably more fine detail; and they have excellent tonal/color accuracy and gradation. I cannot discern any dithering, half tone patterns, banding, or pizza wheel tracks even at the 2nd best setting of 1440 dpi. This is also the first photo ink jet I've used which can produce B&W prints that rival what I'm able to produce in the darkroom. And it does so with ease via the Advanced B&W mode. The printer design is mature. Set ... up was a breeze, print head alignment is automatic, and navigating the print dialog is a cinch. Everything feels well built and sturdy. I haven't had the printer long, but while I've had it there have been a couple 2-3 week periods where I didn't print a thing, yet I haven't had a single clog. On all past printers I had to waste ink after a 2-3 week gap. Speaking of ink the initial cartridge set is lasting a long time. I've produced a 50 page 17x22 portfolio and I've lost count of the 8x10's I've printed, yet most of my carts are still at more than 50%. Out of the box Epson's profiles work perfectly. I have never had an easier time getting prints to match my calibrated screen. I have only two minor complaints. One, I wish the photo and matte black inks did not share a print head channel. The printer holds them both and switches between them automatically, but some ink is lost flushing the channel with each switch. It's not so much ink as to be a big deal. But you do have to think about it and batch your glossy and matte prints to minimize ink loss. I also wish Epson would ship paper 17x26 instead of 17x22. 17x22 works for trimming down to 16x20, but not for 16x24 which is the correct ratio for DSLRs and 35mm. For 16x24 you have to buy roll paper and cut it yourself, or look to 3rd party papers. I have never been this satisfied with a photo ink jet printer. It is the best in its class and I highly recommend it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I love the colors produced by this printer and the fact that I have not run out of ink yet! Much better value compared to competitors at or below this price point. I would spend 15 buck for every ten 13x19 prints I made. I have made 15 prints from this and I still haven't expended half of the ink cartridges

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Cons: Large Footprint; Hard Setup
So far, I haven't done a lot of printing with this yet, but it looks very promissing. Having some trouble getting the printer to match my display(seems to be a common problem). The prints come out too warm, yet they are still beautiful. In time, I'll get the setup right and I'm sure I'll be happy with my purchase. I'm just a little disapointed with Adorama sending me products that had previously been opened. I paid for new, not open box items.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this printer after lengthy research. As a loyalist to products, the only camera for me is a Nikon, the only computer for me is a MAC & the only photo printer for me is an Epson, the question was simply which one. This print offers me the ability to print real deal images in archival inks & paper with wonderful rich saturated colors the pop off the page. I read manuals as a last resort and I found this an easy printer to set up, it performed right out of the box. It is very user friendly and with paper handling options it has great flexibility. My first big print delivered everything I envisioned and expected bold colors and deep textures so vivid you think you can pick the objects right off the paper. This is the right level for me, as I am not interested in the inve ... stment required to go to a larger format, I will leave that up to my print service provider. This is very manageable for me as an Artist/enthusiast/professional. Primarily I am a sculptor photography is not my primary activity. My concerns so far are the learning curve does cost money in consumables wasted on little quirks. Like making sure you have the tray pulled out completely and plantar setting right or else you will waste paper with smudges & faint lines. Still learning this one but feel comfortable giving this machine 4*. The minus * is for the little quirks not fully developed nor addressed in the manuel but phone in support is great (so far). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: The Epitome of Fine Art Inkjet Printing
Item.Review: I am a semi-professional photographer with more than thirty years of experience and produce fine art prints for clients, books and exhibition. Having worked with traditional darkroom printing methods and, for the past six years, inkjet printing on the Epson Stylus Photo 2200, I have found the Epson Stylus Pro 3880 to be a major advance in fine art printing beyond anything I have experienced to date. It is for me a fine art photographer's printing dream machine. The colors are crisp, clean and brilliant. Black and white output is nothing less than stunning. It interfaces easily with my Mac and prints come out much faster than I expected. Set up was very easy out of the box but, heeding the warnings about all of the packing tape, I took care to remove all of it. There is a great deal o ... f tape in places least expected in order to secure the machine for shipment and it takes time to remove it. Be very careful to remove all of it before activating the printer or damage could result. The only difficulty I ran into when setting up the printer was the instructions indicated that once the print cartridges were installed and the printer was powered up, it would begin to automatically prime the print lines. The instructions indicated this would take from 7 to 10 minutes. Although I followed the instructions exactly, my printer did not prime the ink lines. It wasn't until I actually started printing test pages that the ink started to flow and it primed the lines. This was a minor inconvenience that was easily overcome but could be more problematic for someone new to inkjet printers. To date I have produced over 100 prints since I got the printer a month ago and they are without a doubt the most beautiful prints I have ever created. The output from this printer is far beyond anything I have ever gotten from a commercial photo lab and they surely beat the quality of prints I made in a darkroom. I am also pleased with the relatively small footprint this printer occupies in my digital lab. I am somewhat limited in available space and to set up a machine capable of printing as large as this one does into such a small space is a feat of technological engineering. If you are serious about obtaining the finest print quality possible in an inkjet printer whether for exhibition, sales or for personal pleasure, then this is the printer to get. You will not be dissappointed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The colors are beautiful and the printer is easy to assemble and use. I am very pleased. I was initially quite intimidated because of the enormous size and number of ink cartridges. However, everything is quite simple and wonderful.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Decided to take the plunge and get a large format printer that could produce professional prints, and the Epson 3880 did not disappoint. I have used it to produce a number of 8x10, 11x14 and 12x18 prints, and it produces stunning prints, and is as good as I had hoped for when spending the $$. The printer is well made, came well packed, and was easy to set up. I ended up also buying the Tumi cover for it as I wanted to protect my investment. I love the fact it has large (80ml) ink tanks which will last for many prints, and the choice of paper paths allows for a variety of photo and fine art paper types. I have no regrets on the cost, as the value of the ink in the 80ml cartridges makes the purchase worth it. The only negative would be it does not support roll paper, which I did not pl ... an on using. It will allow you to print on paper up to 17x37 via a customer paper size setup in the driver, which will still allow for panoramic prints. Though Epson does not have paper in those sizes, other paper makers do have some panoramic size sheet paper. This printer does not disappoint and is worth the extra cost over smaller Epson models. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I previously had an Epson 1400. I upgraded to the 3880 instead of the 2880 for several reasons. Among them was the larger ink reservoir. Another factor was cost. When I subtracted the value of the ink supplied from the total cost of each, the cost was not the different to go with the wider, closer to professional machine. Right out of the box, I was pleased with print quality vs. the 1400. To minimize my learning curve (need to play with profiles), I have started with Epson Premium Luster paper. So far (about 40 prints), every print has had colors as expect with no operation issues with this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: As Near to Perfect as Possible
Item.Review: Needing a larger format printer than the one I was using for personal use and sales of my prints I extensively reviewed the Epson 3880. I can say, without reservation, that the printer has met, and exceeded, my expectations. The set-up took about 15 minutes. Started with USB and then went to the Network connectivity. In both cases the instructions and hook-up was accomplished without any problems (Win 7, 64-bit) I have printed using both Epson and other professional quality papers with their associated Profiles loaded. I use PS CS5 and/or Lightroom 3 to manage the colors and the output has been spot-on to the colors on my fully calibrated dual monitors. While the printing is just a bit slower than what I have been used it is not really a Con or a deal breaker. Having been using 13ml ink c ... artridges the 80ml units in the Epson is a pleasure and the overall cost of the ink is greatly reduced. Ink usage appears to be more than reasonable. If there is one thing I have noticed it is that if the setting Printer Manages Colors is used the photos come out with a bit more Magenta castes and a little less Green Vibrancy and Saturation. Both of these traits have been mentioned in various articles. Using Applications to manage the colors eliminates this tendency. The other option would be to calibrate the monitors to the print output but I prefer the method I am using. While it took a while for me to become comfortable with Epson's Print Dialog and Custom Paper Settings (a bit more complex than what I was used to) they are fairly well explained in the manual. Along with the larger format I also use the unit to print smaller sized Panoramas (12-14 x 36)... Which may come as a bit of a surprise to those that think it only prints to 17x22. Actually, you can print up to 17x37.6. It took me a bit to figure that out as Epson doesn't make a point of advertising this capability. As I don't have the space for really large Pano's this smaller size is perfect. And I didn't have to go to a much larger (and more expensive) roll printer. While the 3880 is not an inexpensive printer I feel it is worth every penny and highly recommend it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use it mainly to print large format color and black-and-white photos. However, it also prints smaller sizes just as well as big sizes. It also has a relatively small footprint given the size of the prints it puts out. It is a bit slow, especially when set to highest quality. However, one should expect it to be slow in the high-quality mode. Also, for a printer of this caliber, I can't imagine why Epson put such a flimsy plastic print tray on this otherwise high-quality printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Reliable; Easy To Set Up; Durable construction
Cons: Large Footprint
This printer creates outstanding prints. The included print management software is very flexible and easy to use. Its ability use manage the entire print process or use external print management drivers is key. Given its 17" printing capability. this is not a small printer, but I had not extent it to be. Its only shortfall would be the fact that there is a limit to the 'long side' dimension(you can't print a 17" x 50" print for example), its restriction is more to the 17" x 25" size.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Setup was easy. I was making prints within 30 minutes of opening the box. This is my first professional level printer and I was extremely happy with the results. Color prints are awsome and the black and whites rival those that I have made in the darkroom. My only knock is that I wish it would warn you before switching from photo glossy to matt. If you mistakingly select the wrong paper profile it will do the conversion from glossy to matt or visa versa, wasting a lot of ink. I am now very careful to make sure paper profiles are right before hitting the print button. This is a very small negative for an outstanding printer

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'm fairly new to photography but wanted a good printer to add to my hardware. The 3880 was easy to setup and I was printing in no time. The quality is amazing. I highly recommend this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great product from a great company!
Item.Review: I ordered the Epson 3880 printer because of the price, rebate, and positive reviews. This was my first purchase from B&H and I can honestly say that I am very impressed with their speed and professionalism. The printer is 50 pounds and the shipping was free. The printer is 50 pounds and it was set-up in my house 6 days after I placed the order. Did I mention that I live in Okinawa, Japan? That's right, B&H processed my order and shipped to my FPO/AP address in Okinawa within 6 days! Thank you B&H for excellent service, shipping, and packaging.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I upgraded from an Espon 2400 and am very happy with the prints. Colors are great and the detail is good. The printer was easy set up and has been very easy to use.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Epson 3880 is a fantastic printer. My first photo printers was an Epsons. They however cannot to the compare to the quality of print produced with the 3880. Out of the box the 3880 produced great prints. No problems setting it up. Details are clear and will defined, even in darker areas of a photo. I expect this to be my last printer purchase for quite some time. I am very pleased with the quality and operation of the Epson 3880.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I have been waiting for the Epson 4900 for years. When it finally came out, my needs had changed. I no longer can justify the cost of ink when I'm only printing 200 prints over 17 inches per year. SO I went for the 3880. It is giving me gorgeous prints and although it takes longer to print, it's worth the wait. Easy to set up, paper profiles good and got going right out of the box. As usual, the maintenance tank filled halfway just charging the printer, so order a maintenance tank with this printer, you'll need it pretty soon.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Setup was a snap, and the instructions are dead on. The print quality is simply stunning. I couldn't be happier: it exceeds my expectations by a mile. Get yours.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Amateur photographer. The output of this printer is terrific if you use a proper workflow with color calibrated monitor and icc profiles for the right paper and ink combination. Vivid, true-to-life colors; details you never knew existed (flaws too) in your photographs show up. Do use ABW profiles for BW work. They work great on Baryta papers. So far I have used Ilford Gold Fiber Silk, Epson Exhibition Fiber, Hahnemuhle Fine Art Baryta and Ilford Galerie Smooth Pearl (for 5x7 prints). All recommended.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is my first 17 printer and it is working very well with my Power Mac (OS 10.72). The prints look very good and I'm letting the printer manage color instead of Photoshop. This seems to work well. Colors are very similar to my calibrated display. My only problem has been getting 17x22 to print perfect aligned when set to borderless. There is a 50/50 chance the paper will get slightly skewed. The printer itself is nicely made and fairly lightweight. Many other 17 printers weigh 50 to 100 pounds. I could easily lift this printer out of the box, place it on a chest and get things set-up. The Canon IPF-5x00 is HUGE. Delivery and set-up was a big concern since I needed to get the printer carried to the 2nd story.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: beautiful prints, quick set up on a Mac
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy To Setup
On an iMac it took very little time to match the screen to the prints making great prints up to 17x22 easy. My living room wall (a large high expanse) now has photo art to liven it up. This is a great printer!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've only had my printer for about a week now. Setup was easy, of course I was excited to print a photo, so I printed a rather detailed and complex photo as soon as I got everything hooked up. Without any calibration the photo print turned out very well; I was pleased. I then calibrated my monitor and the Epson 3880 printer together with my colormunki and got better results. This printer is quite a step up form my Epson Stylus Photo R1900. My 1900 seemed to print a little on the dark side regardless of calibration. Color saturation and smoothness are better with the 3880 than with the R1900. This printer does not support roll stock but it will print a very nice 16 X 36 photo. Overall I am very pleased with my Epson 3880 printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am advanced amateur/semi pro who does sports, portrait and wedding photography. This is my fourth Epson printer and though I have been happy with all of them, the 3880, which I have had for 7 months, is outstanding. It was extremely easy to set up and the colors are great. The ink cartridges are expensive but last a long time. I just replaced the lt black and photo black. The only feature I would like, is the ability to use roll paper. I highly recommend this printer to any serious photographer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Pro Printer at a Reasonable Price
Item.Review: I just calibrated my NEC monitor and the first print that came out of the printer was perfect. I am using Adobe RGB and the Intensity of the calibration was 120, Gamma was 2.20 and the White Point was D65. The paper I used was Epson Ultra Premium Luster. I just love the colors and the shadow detail and I could see the highlights in the white areas. For the price I would recommend this printer. My old printer was the Epson 2200 and there is such a difference in print quality. In the future I am also looking at the Epson 4900. It took very little time to set up the printer too.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: So far I like this printer, I have no complaints. Haven't had it long enough. It was easy to setup and use. I would recommend this printer to a friend. Prints quality photo's.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'm a serious amateur photographer who enters a lot of print competitions and I've even managed to sell a few. This printer replaces my much-loved R2880 with the same quality printing, much more cost-efficient print cartridges, and excellent build quality. Printing is flawless. It's also very easy to find print profiles for just about every kind of paper I've tested.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer in conjunction with an iMAC computer and Aperture 3. The 3880 was painless to set up - very intuitive and quick - less than 45 minutes despite following every step. I am very happy with the tone and hue reproduction achieved with the mentioned combination. However, I have not run a calibration. I find that reducing the screen intensity of the iMAC monitor to nearly the minimum (at 2.2 gamma setting), my prints display a perceived equal amount of luminosity as the Apple monitor. That is an impressive accomplishment for anybody who has had difficulties with calibrations back when we were all using CRT monitors. The 3880's performance is swift when considering the quality of the finished prints both in terms of color rendition and edge detail. There is no blurring and no gu ... essing what color was originally observed through the viewfinder. I have printed about 110 8x10 enlargements and just one of the nine ink cartridges is showing less than 50% remaining which equals stellar economy of operation. A final note: when purchasing a 3880, try to remember that the cost includes nine ink cartridges that total over $500 retail which means the buyer gets a heck of a printer for around $450. I doubt there is a better product available for controlling your product in such an economical way. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use my Epson 3880 printer for personal use. I am a senior BFA photography major at the University of Miami in Florida. I use the Epson 3800 in the lab on campus but I rarely have time to print my work from outside of class. For my 22nd birthday this March, my mom got me the Epson 3880. The setup was a breeze and I started printing immediately. The colors were matched perfectly to my screen. It even came with some paper that I used to print the first image on it. It works great and is a great product.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This unit is a great buy for photo prints on canvas or coated paper! It produces amazing results with true to life colors! Have used many printers in the past, this one is outstanding! Have operated a wet darkroom for color printing for over 35 years and this unit is the first one to match the out put of my 16x20 RA-4 prints! As a pro lab my clients can't tell if I am using inkjet or a wet lab print!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: I can't believe it's an inkjet printer!
Item.Review: The accuracy and detail of this printer is amazing! Right out of the box with very little setup time and you're printing photo quality prints. Stay within the Adobe color space and very little color correction is required.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Epson Stylus Pro 3880 replaced my HP Photosmart B9180 which I've had for four years, and for those in the same situation - you won't be disappointed. The 9180 was a great printer, but always a bit finicky - and by comparison - a bit difficult to set up and use. The 3880 is a breeze. It took five minutes to figure out the basic color management strategy and in no time I was producing gorgeous prints that surpass the quality of the best the 9180 ever delivered. And when I think about what I spent on the Epson I remind myself that I'm going to save money over time; until I started doing research for this purchase I had no idea how wickedly expensive the HP ink was. A couple of other things, I'm sure covered in other's comments - if you had a 9180 the 3880 fits in exactly the same pla ... ce. If you have an ethernet network you can configure the printer and set everything up over the network, unlike the HP which required a USB connection during the initial set up. It's quieter and the printer itself doesn't move around nearly as much during printing. The HP shook the unit it sat on when it printed, the 3880 is rock solid. And this may be a big deal, again if you're replacing a 9180 - I looked all over the internet for some profiles that would let me use my left-over HP paper on the Epson and I found none. So I just tried using, for instance, HP Advanced Glossy paper using the profile for Epson's glossy photo paper and the prints are incredible - again, easily richer, more dimensional, more lifelike than the HP. I have no doubt that I'll get similar results with the A3+ satin paper I have left over as well. But if you're one of those that assumed (because it said as much on the package) that HP's best photo printer should work with HP's best Premium Photo Plus paper, only to learn that the paper was TOTALLY incompatible with the pigment inks - sorry - it doesn't work with the Epson either. I called HP headquarters in Palo Alto (Phone: [@]) and reached Executive Customer Service and the kind person there sent me more than the equivalent amount of Advanced Photo paper to replace my Premium Plus paper.I'm looking forward to trying all sorts of media with my new 3880 and looking forward to (I hope) several years with this one. I do plan to buy an extended service policy before the one year warranty expires. Just in case. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am an amateur working on improving all aspects of my photographic ability. I finally broke down and got Photoshop CS5 and this printer because I was no longer satisfied with my HP all-in-one and inexpensive editing software. Well, this printer really makes great prints, but it has taken me a week of work and research to get there. With 10 inks at its disposal this printer can do remarkable images. But you need to calibrate your monitor and pay attention to the details. Kelby's book, The Adobe Photoshop CS5 book, has been really helpful. It is also important to use good paper because you won't get the same quality of print from inexpensive papers. In my view, all of this has been more than worthwhile. I have been able to produce images that were impossible for me a few weeks ago. ... Especially some shots in a Mexican fishing village where the colors and poverty just jump out at you. This printer really makes a difference. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Beautiful prints. My only regret is they are so nice I wish I could print even larger. I will need to upgrade in the future up to the 7900 or 9880. So, far I have printed B&W landscapes on canvas-Amazing detail and smooth transition and 16x24's and 12x18's for wedding clients in color and toned-stunning. Even better than the darkroom to watch them roll out of the printer. Important note that I had to research on my own: you can print up to a 37.4 inch print by going into user defined print size without special software. You should be careful to load very straight if attempting this.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Bringing Printing to a Whole New Level
Item.Review: This printer is truly unbelievable. I researched EVERY printer under $2000K and this is the ONLY one that did not result in a compromise for the advanced amateur. This printer excels not only at color, not only at B&W, but BOTH - regardless of the size of the prints (up to 17 x 22).From what I have carefully researched, compromises needed to be made with either the Epson Sylus Pro 2880, the Canon Pixma Pro9000 Mk II, and the Canon Pixma Pro9500 Mk II. The Epson Stylus Pro 3880 ALONE allows you to have your cake and it it too for under $2495 (now that the Epson Stylus Pro 4900 has been released - prior to that release the Epson Stylus Pro 3880 was the BEST printer available for under $5000!!!)You really have to experience this to believe it. Read as many reviews as you can, email Ep ... son and request some sample prints, and make an informed decision.I found B&H's prices and reputation unbeatable. They are an authorized Epson dealer (which makes a difference in regards to Epson honoring any rebates, and they offer free shipping and no taxes outside of NY, USA)I have owned various HP Photosmart Printers prior to this and have been very happy with the quality of the prints, but this printer is truly CUSTOM LAB QUALITY.This is also the cheapest printer to operate for the Advanced Amateur. The 80ml cartridges cost [$] each (as of this writing), which is FAR cheaper that any other printer with smaller sized cartridges ([$]).DISADV - I found that I also had to calibrate my monitor in order to obtain the most accurate print colors. After much research I settled on a Spyder3 Elite - although this was a compromise decision based upon ease of use and bang per buck. I would have perferred a monitor AND printer profiler, but the outlay of cash would have been too great. (As long as you stick with Epson papers you will not have to be concerned about profiling the paper.)Epson printer support AND Datacolor's SPYDER3 Profiler support are both EXCELLENT. DataColor especially is very responsive and that response is not canned - the response actually has to due with your particular inquiry and even asks personal questions beyond your inquiry.Expensive - yes, but only initially. Long-term, this is one of the LEAST expensive printers to operate using factory ink.I also recommend using a printing application for ALL photo printing. For the advanced amateur NOTHING beats QIMAGE ULTIMATE. Again, read the reviews and make an informed decision. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great prints, if a bit quirky
Item.Review: Super prints from 8x10 to 17x22. Only real complaint is that it will occasionally give different error messages that (so far) are resolved by rebooting the printer. This has happened right from the install. Keep in mind the refills total about half the price of the printer for a complete set. We use Epson Ultra Premium luster paper in the aforementioned sizes. We print weekly to reduce print head clogging (we have not had any thus far).

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Epson Stylus Pro 3380 produces beautiful black and white and color prints. It's my first experience with a printer of this quality that uses pigment inks and has multiple shades of black to optimize B&W printing. I have a favorite 30-year-old image of my son and his great grandmother that I've never been able make a decent black and white print from...until now. Using a Lightroom B&W conversion of a scanned Kodachrome slide and Epson's Advanced B&W print driver, with very little effort, I was able make the print that I had long envisioned but could never produce. Color prints on Epson's Premium luster and matt papers are excellent with impressive color fidelity using the supplied Epson ICC profiles. Although I'm very happy with the printer in most respects, and would recom ... mend it, I do have a few beefs. The network connection is finicky. Initial set-up went without a hitch, but the following day, after restarting the printer, I lost my network connection. My initial set-up used the default auto mode to automatically obtain the IP address from my router's DHCP server. After the printer obtained the IP address, I then set the port in the Epson print driver to this address as instructed in the manual. The printer worked fine, but when I restarted the printer the following day, it was automatically given a new IP address that no longer matched the port in the print driver. After manually setting the IP address to match the port, the printer was back online. Unfortunately, the following day, it again went offline even though the port and printer IP address matched. A reboot of my Windows 7 computer seemed to fix the problem. I have another network printer, which has been in service for several years, and has never had a networking problem. I think Epson may need to build a more robust self-healing network driver. Another beef. Why can't Epson warn you when a print job requires a switch between photo black and matt black inks. I did a test print to plain paper, not realizing that it would cause the driver to switch from photo to matt black, which of course wastes ink. Another time I set the driver to the wrong paper type, and ended up wasting more ink. Yes, this was my fault, but I'm guessing I'm not the only one who has made these mistakes. Please Epson, with the next version of you print driver, give us a warning when switching inks. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use the 3800 at the school I teach photography at and run it through it's paces everyday. It is an amazing machine. So, I decided to buy the 3880 for my photo business and it is even more amazing than the 3800! The colors are beautiful and it makes the best looking photos I've seen from a printer it's size. I even print with amazing results on canvas too.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: BEST PHOTO PRINTER ON THE MARKET
Item.Review: EXTREMELY EASY TO SET UP AND GREAT PRINTS FROM THIS PRODUCT. I WOULDN'T HESITATE TO BUY AGAIN. THE REBATE FROM EPSON WAS JUST ICING ON THE CAKE COUPLED WITH B&H'S ALREADY LOW PRICE.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Took advantage of the $300 rebate and have no regrets so far. It makes beautiful prints (I've been using 3880's to print at ICP for almost a year so I know the product and is abilities well). It was easy to set up out of the box and worked right away.The only real con is the price of ink. Once I refill all the ink cartridges twice, I will have paid for another printer. Ouch.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Have only had this printer for a week but so far i am blown away. Image quality is fantastic and it prints much faster than my old 2200 printer. Aside from getting used to a slightly different interface it was easy to get up and running and making great prints. Being able to switch between photo and matte black inks is a huge plus. Highly recommended.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: It is everything I was told it was...
Item.Review: I use the Epson 3880 to print fine art B&W photos. I have only had it for a week but have been quite impressed with the quality of the Epson Advanced B&W print feature. It is absolutely stunning. The fact that this printer will automatically change from Matte Black to Photo Black is amazing. It will load the appropriate ink according to the paper/media selected. It is small enough to fit easily on my desk next to my computer. It's quiet and has an attractive design. I don't use it for production work so the print speed is not a problem for me. I used to print in a darkroom and it took a lot longer to get a finished print. I'm quite satisfied and would highly recommend this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is an outstanding printer and value for the money. It has given me consistently good prints both black and white and color. Easy to set up and start printing right out of the box. My only complaint is that when using the rear manual feed the paper is sometimes difficult to load correctly, but this is definitely not a deal breaker. There is no roll feeder which may be a negative for some, but not for my use, which is about 3 - 4 final 13x19 prints every other day. The larger ink cartridges are a definite plus.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer rejects the paper fed into the rear manual slot about 9 out of ten times. I have a 2200 which has a manual feed lever and it's a workhorse in my studio. The 3880 refuses to easily load papers manually and wastes my time for each print. Given that, the colors and quality are very good but I wish there was a 17in wide option that was less tempermental.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I mainly use the printer for personal use. I've had it about two weeks and it has exceeded my expectations. First, it was very easy to set up. I have a Vista operating system and all I had to do was use the DVD that came with the system. It was also very easy to add an ICC profile for exhibition paper from the Epson website and it worked! I have printed 4X6, 5X7, 8X10, and 13X19 all with the same professional results. The colors match my calibrated monitor to a tee.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The printer does a great job in all respects. The issues I have is with Epson's on going support of this printer and all their printers. I had the 3800 Pro for 3.5 years when it died. After contacting Epson and a authorized repair center, I was told / warned the cost of repair would be $750 to $950 and I could replace the printer for about [$].???Sure I could, but the point is that this is NOT a $50-$100 throw away printer. It was a [$] (what I paid for it on sale with the RIP) Professional printer!! It should last longer than 3.5 years, and it should not cost the 3/4 of the cost of a replacement printer to repair. After many emails, Epson simply refused to work with me in any way to help reduce the cost of repair. They even said that this is not normal for this printer and it should last ... far more than 3.5 years. I offered to pay the labor costs ($350) if they would supply the parts at n/c. They said nope. They said Epson does not provide any support after the warranty runs out. So if it's out of warranty, your on your own to repair or replace the printer, no matter what it costs or what how much money you invested up front for a professional product.???This makes me rethink if I should buy an Epson printer or look at a Canon or HP, maybe you should to before you drop a bundle on a professional printer.As a footnote, I did cough up the bucks (regrettably) for the 3880. We needed something to replace the 3800 and didn't have the time to research and profile another brand. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use the product at home because I was frustrated with prints purchased online not matching what I saw on the screen. This printer provides prints that will last and allow me to create various sizes and not sacrifice quality. The size of the printer should be considered but it is surprisingly modular, which decreases its footprint when not in use.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great IQ satisfies reborn ink junkie
Item.Review: Have had the printer only for 2 weeks, but the photographic image quality is high, as expected. Looks like photographs! not digital prints. Main worry is of cause clogging and constantly running out of ink caused by cleaning procedures. Ink cost is high, and I hate of cause becoming an ink junky. But this goes for all the printer producers, and comes with the new development of the trade. Cheap printer-costy ink. Consequence; trow your printer when ink is empty, cheaper to by a new one. Keeps China happy, but not very green in 2010!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I do Fall & Spring Photos for a private school, about 150 Students. I was using photo place at the mall but wanted to save some money and do photos at home. The quality of pictures is better than mall guys, I'm printing on Epson PREM LUSTER PAPER (LETTER) 8.5x11/50. Work Flow has been great by the time I've done Photo Shop work on a picture the print package is done from previous student. I would give it 5 stars except Ink price is still expensive. Looking like I'm break even with mall guys with my bulk discount but better than retail.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: For many years , I've used letter-size printers for both photos and everyday home computer use. My very few large format prints were reserved for the professional shops but I never felt that, for the cost, I had full control over the product. I decided to graduate to a dedicated, large format, pigment based printer to reach the next level in my photography.After researching product lines and reviews for many months, I was drawn to the Epson Stylus Pro 3880 because of it's smaller footprint, large capacity ink cartridges, 17-in wide capability, relatively lower cost, and reviewed print quality. [...] - This printer suits my needs perfectly. The printer installed without problem. I use it through a laptop docking station to which it is permanently connected by USB cable. I originally p ... referred wireless capability but I find that it's not necessary since I like to be next to the printer for paper handling and watching the progress during a print session. Since I was new to large format pigment ink printing, I also ordered 8?? x 11 paper sample packs from Museo and Inkpress with the printer and from Red River from their website. The printer handled all of the tested papers flawlessly, the only miss-feed being with (believe it or not) a 4x6 Epson paper that I had been using to conserve ink during testing. It took a bit of time to get used to the hardware controls and the printer Properties window settings but it does get easier and the manual is helpful, although a bit limited. Epson responded immediately (within minutes) to an e-mail when I had a problem with deleting a custom printer size - not covered in the manual. That, alone, is cause for me to put Epson at the top of my list for future hardware acquisitions. I photograph in RAW+JPG, use Nikon Capture NX2 and/or SilkyPix 4 for development,and PS Elements 7 for final adjustment of TIFF files. I usually print from SilkyPix and all prints, whether custom profile or on the printer side with Epson paper, looked great - I was blown away when looking at my first large prints. My only issue is that non-adjusted prints seem to be about 1-stop darker than my calibrated monitor (Spyder 3 Express). Turning down the screen brightness and adjusting curves to increase mid-tone brightness is my remedy but I don't think this is a 3880 issue since my old HP printer also printed darker than what was shown on the screen.The only possible con that I can think of is attempting to do production printing without the capability of printing from rolls - but I didn't penalize the printer because I don't consider it a requirement for a non-business machine. In summary, I highly recommend this professional printer that can easily make the transition to the home. You won't regret it, especially when you hold those large photos, printed to your exact liking. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is my first pro- or prosumer photo printer. I've had laserjets that work fine, but don't print photos well, and cheap inkjets that work ok for a month or two, then run out of ink repeatedly, and ink seems to be made from the horn of a particularly rare kind of unicorn. I have high hopes for this printer, with its individually replaceable cartridges. So far the prints I've done have been very impressive, though I haven't worked out the color management enough to my liking to print large yet. They look wonderful though, just don't quite match what I see on my screen yet. With the rebate, essentially you're buying the ink and getting the printer for a very reasonable price. So this was a deal I couldn't pass up. Epson: When are you going to get a real Mac installer and control pa ... nel, not the OS 9 looking stuff that's over a decade old now? That said, it installed relatively easily. I had to restart it a couple of times to get it to install on my Mini; worked fine on a different computer. I bought the Tumi cover, seems like this (or at least a cover) ought to be included. It's dusty everywhere I've ever lived. I can't imagine that's good for an inkjet printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Fast Print Time; Easy To Use
Images are spectacular and color accurate. Depth of color is excellent. It is faster and it uses less ink than I anticipated.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: the epson r3880 printer- a real god-send
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Durable construction; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Easy To Setup
Adorama is very efficient in getting the product to me, in all the cases I've had. The Epson r3880 printer is a jewel, no contest there! The quality is gorgeous! Adoramas prices on the inks are $8.00 too much!!!!! Look around, the prices are really about 52.00 each color.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I upgraded from an Epson R2400 and while the print quality appears to be the same, the 3880 has those large ink cartridges that lower the cost per print. I love the auto-switching between matte and gloss black as I use Epson Lustre and Velvet extensively and appreciate not having to swap out ink cartridges when changing between these papers. The printer has a lot more customization available than my previous machine and it is much easier to load heavy papers in the manual slot than with the R2400. On the downside, the printer driver is a lot more complex, though I'm getting used to it. The R2400 Windows printer driver menus should be a model for the industry. They're even better than those on the MacIntosh. So far, the only downside I have seen is the lack of roll printing, but I have ... n't found the need for it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: We're a photography school. We have 5 of these, plus several other printers. The 3880 is good at both color and B&W. We've found them reliable so far (about 2 yrs), in moderate to heavy use. We estimate ink cost at around 65 cents per ml vs. about $1.00/ml for the R1900. Foot print on the countertop is only about an inch more than the R1900 - pretty compact for a 17 printer. I like this model.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Low Ink Consumption; Reliable; Glitch-free
Cons: Large Footprint
Prints my fine art photography flawlessly. In two years of ownership, not a single print jam or clogged nozzle. Huge ink cartridges last a long time.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The Epson Pro 3880 is an investment worth every cent. It is not difficult to use. The profiles are easy to find online and, really, other than the 17 by 22 size limitation, only your mind limits what you can print on. I have run about 30 prints since I made and purchase. My partner laughs because every time I lift on off the printer to go to the drying rack, I exclaim: This printer is beyond awesome! It is!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: This Printer beats the 4000, hands down!
Item.Review: I'm a semi-professional photographer specializing in wildlife. For the last 6 years I've been using (or attempting to use) an Epson Pro 4000. The print quality from the 4000 was excellent, but I spent hours, and lots of expensive ink, attempting to unclog its printhead. That's why I bought the 3800. It's two generations ahead of the 4000, and the advances in technology show. The image quality is improved, and I've used the 3880 for two weeks on a daily basis with perfect nozzle checks, and NO print head clogs. I have not had to clean the print head once. My 27 NEC display is calibrated, and the prints from the 3880 are spot-on using the Epson profiles. And the best part is that I'm using considerably less ink than I did with the 4000.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: After owning an Epson R1800 for three years I finally upgraded to the 3880 mostly for the ability to make larger prints. Unlike the R1800, the 3880 will not print roll paper or directly on CD's and does not use a gloss optimizer. While roll paper and CD printing are not an issue for me, I do miss the gloss optimizer. Still for the increase in printing quality and ability to make larger prints I'm more than willing to give up the gloss optimizer. The difference in printing quality of the two printers is most obvious in less saturated images where the smoothness of the color transitions is more apparent. Using the Epson printer profile for their luster paper I made my first print and was very happy with the results. I then made a custom printer profile using an X-rite Pulse and produce ... d an even better print of the same image. If you want to get the best out of a printer, custom profiling is the way to go. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: When I saw my first print I said WOW.
Item.Review: Easy to set up, printer exceeds my expectations. I scanned some old but very valuable slides I have had for nearly 40 years. These were of a P-51 that I had repainted in 1975. They were a little grainy, with some minor work in Lightroom 3 I printed them and they came to life. The prints were very sharp much better then the slides.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The 3880 was easy to unpack and get operational. The whole color management tasks, does take some study, but even my first print was a good match to my monitor. The quality of the prints is great. I tried printing directly from Lightroom and Photoshop. The types of papers that are commonly used on pro printer's runs the cost of use up, but I think I am going to enjoy having more control over the quality and the ability to print 17 inch wide images. I did not find the Epson website easy to use when I went looking for paper profiles.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Easy To Use; Compact Design; Easy To Setup
Cons: Ink tanks to small
this is a great printer, the size is great for a small office with out loosing the 17 wide printing. The only bummer is that it doesn't due roll paper or paper that is longer then 38inches. If you don't need that it is the best printer for the price.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer to make large prints of my photos -- often as large as 17x22. I'm very impressed with the quality of the prints, and the colors that I get from this printer. When I first bought a printer of this size (my 3880 was a replacement for the 3800 that I owned for several years), I thought I'd be spending a lot of money on ink. In fact, both printers have been impressively frugal. If anyone is curious to know the main difference between this and the previous model, the 3800, it is that the 3880 uses Epson's two new, vivid magenta inks, whereas the 3800 used the old magentas. In finished prints, I find the differences to be subtle (which is a *good* thing). My one criticism, and it is not serious enough in my view to warrant a less than five-star review, is that it sometimes t ... akes several attempts to get the paper to feed correctly when using the rear paper feed (which is the only option for some papers). The printer has a tendency to report a paper skew, requiring me to re-insert the paper. This can be time-consuming if I have many prints to make. I have no hesitation in recommending this printer. In fact, when my old 3800 failed beyond economical repair, I immediately replaced it with this, the current model. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This has been the best investment I have made for my photography. The prints I have made so far have been spectacular. Looking forward to printing larger prints. Colors have been spot on and as long as you double check your settings for color management, you will be pleased with the results.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Was working with an Epson 1400 and Dell 2410 monitor and becoming frustrated with how difficult it was to get a really good match between monitor and printed output, even with colorimeter profiling of both units. Finally a friend whose opinion I respect told me that I was applying professional standards to hobbyist equipment and if I was going to be so persnickety I'd have to spend some money. Well, he was right on both counts...I got MUCH better results with professional equipment, and I DEFINITELY had to spend some money. Bought this printer and an NEC professional monitor (at B&H salesman's recommendation) and laid out a pile of bucks. Did, however, get what I paid for. Results right out of the box were on a much higher level thanI had been working with, and once I was done pro ... filing the monitor and printer the output was very close to the what one saw on the screen. There is a still a very slightly noticeable darker cast on the print, but I suspect that is a function of my workplace lighting more than anything else. The printer is large, and somewhat heavy for an inkjet. Paper handling is very reliable at all sizes from 4X6 to 13X19. (Printer will go larger, but I haven't needed to yet.) Paper profiles for all of the Epson papers I use are built right into the machine's software, so I imagine it will be very close even without profiling. Ink cartridges are expensive, but then they are also quite large, so you don't replace them often. (I'm still on my first set after dozens of really big prints.) I use the machine at least 4 times a week, so I can't say how well it performs after standing for a long time...seems to me there's a lot of plumbing in there and drying out could be a problem. You might want to research that if your plans include long term idleness, otherwise I'd say this is by far the best machine you're going to find for anywhere near the price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Cons: Hard Setup
The installer wrecked my Mac system files. I have had to rebuild everything from a Time Machine backup and am in touch with Epson to get the driver WITHOUT the installation program. So, beware, if you're on a Mac. I have friends who swear by this printer, so I will persevere, but their tech support so far has been lackluster (bored and disinterested tech on the phone) and it is taking a lot of time to follow up.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Low Ink Consumption; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Easy To Setup; Reliable; Fast Print Time
Cons: No Color Tweaking
I use the 3880 almost exclusively for fine art photography, both black and white and color. Both are extraordinary in the quality delivered. Advanced B&W is a brilliant invention, maintaining the quality of already excellent photo files with minimum adjustment ever required(caution: it cannot improve a dreary dingy photo by itself). It's color rendition is as close to spot-on-accurate, with modest, commercially available calibration, as I can imagine (my color vision is pretty acute).
