Its compactness and light weight are also a gift, especially for one with limited space. The large ink tanks are wonderful and stay fresh far longer than (cauti ... ously) advertised by Epson (i.e. I am still using one or two of the original tanks after more than a year).
It is important to plan printing to avoid many switches between photo black and matte black, since each change takes time and consumes ink. This is just a fact of life and, if you pay attention to what you need to accomplish and plan accordingly, it's not an annoyance. Occasionally, it's unavoidable to have to make a switch or two..., but..., not a big deal.
I always look forward to printing sessions because the process and outcome are enjoyable and rewarding.
I am fortunate not to have had a technical problem as I gather from reviews and blogs that Epson is limited in their propensity to help.
All-in-all it's an amazing piece of equipment. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I had a 3 ink HP printer which I was very happy with. Along came the Epson 3880 and I am blown away with its print quality. Colors are vibrant, ink droplets are non-existant (unlike my HP) and B&W prints are great. I purchased it to get my photography business off the ground and I am very happy with it. The price may be high for some, but it includes about $500 worth of ink right out of the box. No complaints and I am looking forward to years of service with this most excellent printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I went from the Stylus Photo R2400 to the Stylus Pro 3880 due to the need to print images on 17X22. I can't begin to list how much my prints have improved. My first job was on a couple 35th yr anniversary photo shoot at my studio. They couldn't believe how beautiful the prints looked. I used Premium luster and my clients were so amazed, they immediately change their order and added additional prints, to give to their family. Suffice to say, if you can afford this printer, do not hesitate to purchase - it is well worth the investment.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Set up was a breeze. First print was amazing. Black and White just as amazing as color. Went from R1900 to this printer. Difference in ink cost offset much of purchase price.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This printer replaced my Stylus Pro R2400. While I would have liked the roll feed, the quality of my prints certainly is without any concern. The printer is easy to use and, to my knowledge, is the largest Epson printer that prints 4x6 photos.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I upgraded from an R1800 and the difference is unbelievable. I must admit, I read the reviews on here about how this printer produced prints that are as good as what some have achieved in the darkroom and I didn't believe it. Out of the box, the printer produced good prints, but it took me a few times to calibrate it and get it running properly. Once that happened, prints were not good, they were GREAT. Color prints are just stunning. Black and white prints are excellent. I'm used to printing from 4x5 negatives so they're still not quite on par with prints from large negatives, but it's pretty close and I can't tell the difference on smaller prints. If you're looking at this printer then I assume you know about calibrating the entire workflow, which you really need to do to get results. I ... would not recommend this if you're not at least a serious amateur. This printer is a workhorse and needs to run at least a few times a week. It's large and heavy but well worth it. I can't imagine I will ever return to the color darkroom to print anything under 20 x 24 ever again. This printer has really helped me take my work to the next level. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am an advanced photographer preparing to launch my career by printing my photos on the most affordable, professional printer EPSON PRO 3880. It was very easy to use-all I had to do was remove the security tape, install the ink cartridges, and the paper guide. I was printing in less than an hour! The prints are absolutely gorgeous and incredibly true to color. Can't wait to begin selling my photos!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Replacement for my epson 4000. Excellent print colors. Using it to print 16x20 and 16x24 photos. Took a bit of experimenting to get the prints come out the way I wanted them, but having been using a Stylus Pro 4000 for 6 years it didn't take very long. A lot easier to use than the 4000 with much better colors and the print heads don't need to be cleaned as much, espicially after sitting idle for a few days.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I couldn't ask for a better printer. As a serious amateur photographer, this printer delivers it all. Variable sizes and the details in the B+W prints is everything i hoped for and more.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: This Epson Stylus Pro3880 is a keeper!
Item.Review: Because of space issues where I can only have one printer, I use my Epson Stylus Pro3880 printer for all kinds of printing, but mainly for printing photos, and art. My last printer is an Epson Stylus Pro R2400, and except for the fact that I can't print 16x20 pictures, and I ran out of ink really fast, I really love my old Epson Stylus Pro R2400 printer! I really wish I had enough room to use both printers! I bought both these printers, and lots of other things at B&H over the last ten years now, and I would highly recommend them to anyone! The print quality of my Epson Stylus Pro3880 printer, after I made a color profile using my ColorMunki, is really great! When I first set it up, my people photos had a purple tent on their faces. I did some flushes, and recalibrate th ... e print profile about three times, and after that, the colors came out spot on. I don't know how long the print cartridges had been sitting before I got my printer, but I think that one of them might have been a little clogged throwing off the color balance. I've printed about a hundred photos since then, (including a couple of 16x20's), and I haven't had to recalibrate the print profile since then. I haven't had a chance to print out any black & White photos yet, So I can't comment on that yet. All though document printing on good quality plane paper is really sharp using the 1400 DPI setting, I don't recommend using this printer for fast document printing. It took me about an hour to print out my TurboTax tax return files on that setting! The plane paper printing on my Epson Stylus Pro3880 printer looks a lot better than on my old R2400. Photos never looks good on plane paper any way, (even with a printer profile using ColorMinki using PhotoShop CS5 to control the colors). The Pro3800 does a lot better job on printing on plane paper, which is great to know for use on printing small quantities of cheep brochures! My 16x20's came out really sharp! Word of caution: Make sure the photo is really sharp before printing, if it isn't, you will really see it on the 16x20 printout! I really feel that this Epson Stylus Pro3880 printer is a real keeper! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this upgrade for personal use. This printer produces great prints and excellent B&W too. I like the small footprint, only slightly larger than to my previous 13 printer. Ink is more economical also, an added bonus for me. Wish I had purchased sooner.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Upgraded from an Epson r1800 and couldn't be happier. Easy to set up, worked right out of the box, paper loads easily from front and back and the switch from glossy to matte is painless when it's needed. Contemplated the r3000 because of space limitations, but the rebate on this model + the difference in ink capacity erased the price difference so I opted for the ability to make larger prints.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I love this printer!!! I've only used it now for a couple of weeks, so this is a very limited review. The inks lay down very uniformly, but I'm having some issues with the color, as they don't seem to match my screen. I have calibrated my monitor, and profiled to allow photoshop manage colors vs epson management, so once I get that straightened out, prints should come out a little more accurately. The other issues I have is that Epson doesn't include profiles of other paper manufacturers. Also,the manual is very limited, so look for a good book on printing digital photos. I also don't understand why they don't incorporate roll paper, but the custom settings allow for up to 37.4 inches, so probably not an issue. You're not going to get everything in a printer in this price range, but ... with the 3880 you get 95% of the higher line printers at a great price. Overall, this printer is a beautiful machine. Blacks on B/W prints just look gorgeous. Can't wait to print on a nice Moab rag or similar artist papers. Definitely consider this printer when buying. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Professional. Supplement my 4880 that is located my other studio. Since I moved to the 17x22 inch paper size I've been spoiled and have never looked back toward my 2880.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: This is a great pigment ink printer, offering 17-inch wide prints from the smallest hardware footprint available (the equivalent Canon is more than twice the size). Included software profiles for Epson papers are quite good. Economy in the long run is also a big plus. Consider: a 13-inch Epson pigment printer runs about [$], of which perhaps [$] is ink. The 3880 costs more but comes with approximately [$] worth of ink. The only caveat I would add is that I owned an Epson 3800 and it failed after four years and light use. Printhead or ink system failure. Not worth the price to repair. I hope the 3880 serves me far longer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I just received the 3880 printer and all I can say is WOW!!! Setup was painless and after only 10-15 8x10 test prints the results far exceed my expectations. As a fine art photographer, the 3880 will be used for creating large black and white exhibition quality prints. My only regret is that I waited so long to purchase this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer for portraits and scenery. I've been very pleased with the quality of the pictures so far. The results are every bit as good as the pro labs I've tried in the past and it's a plus that if something doesn't come out as expected, I can correct the problem in Photoshop, reprint and get the prints to my customers quickly.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Great!!! That's all I can say.
Item.Review: Set up is very easy and straight forward. I was up and printing with in an hour, the prints are great, and the color is remarkable. The hardest part of setting this printer up was removing the tape and packing that was used for shipping.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Owned many Epson Inkjets and this take the Cake....It is simply incredable. You find yourself wanting to buy a new camera with Hi Res just to do it justice. Awesome paper handling and output. Just buy it! M.L.Butler

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I looked at a variety of printers before deciding on the 3880. Reviews and users comments were consistently favorable and I finally decided to take the plunge. Setup was a breeze and, while it took me a bit to get the hang of using ICC profiles, I can now say that this investment was the best I've made in a while. I expect this printer to deliver exceptional prints for the foreseeable future.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've used the printer for the last two weeks. The setup and calibration was FAR easier than what I've experienced with competing products from a supposedly Highly Placed competitor. The output was simply fantastic. Epson actually understands the demands a photographer places on printing equipment and they provide very good color profiles with the printer. Third party paper providers also support Epson products. Epson is a de-facto standard in photographic printing products. Another nice surprise for me was the lack of computer resource hogging bloatware. Other manufacturers insist on installing all manner of resident programs on a Windows computer, but the Epson install is quite streamlined and VERY unobtrusive. My only regret is that I waited so long to buy this printer. It is a ... big printer, but it makes big prints. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I upgraded from an Epson 2200 that I've had for about 8 years. I wanted the ability to print 16x20 prints and also to print on glossy paper. Right out of the box it printed beautiful, neutral B&W photos. Color is also great. Very pleased.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Easy to set up and run. Comes with good users guide. I will be making giclee prints (reproductions)of my original paintings. Only problem I have so far is matching the color of my monitor screen to the actual print.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'm an experienced photographer but had never done my own ink-jet printing. I bought this printer with some trepidation as I was unsure its color gamut would be wide enough for my more saturated images. Setting up the printer was simple. So far I have printed a mere nine images using the small included package of printing paper. All of these prints are gorgeous, much better looking than I expected given my inexperience and the online comments I've read about steep learning curves. The color gamut appears to be wide enough, though I need to print more images to get a better feel for what's possible. Time will tell but so far I am happy that I purchased this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: For fine arts printing, personal printing, Love the idea that i do not have to change my black inks out, as i did in the Epson 2200. Even the black and whites print beautifully. Easy to set up, easy to use. Inks are expensive, but since i am a member of NAPP, B&H does provide a discount for inks.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I'm not the most experienced user and bought it in part because of the large number of users and their input and information pertaining to it. The few things I needed help on were easy to find. It prints a little darker than the monitor even after calibrating and reducing the monitor luminance, but a slight lightening in PS before printing does the trick for me. The color is very true to what I see on the monitor.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: I would buy this product again!
Item.Review: This printer is used as a complement to our Epson 1800. I am truly impressed that the 3880 is able to print my photos to a professional quality. Friends, neighbors, and family are already asking for prints to hang on their walls. I start with an excellent photo, and the 3880 allows me to produce a printout that is truly fantasic! It's a really great printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I previously had an Epson 3800 when they were first introduced and for a semi-pro who likes printing as well as shooting it was perfect. The 3880 looks identical to the 3800 with a couple very nice improvements: new vivid magenta ink cartridges and an improved print head to help prevent clogging. The 80ml cartridges are more friendly to your wallet compared to smaller cartridges found in most 13 wide printers. The prints from the 3880 are outstanding.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I had used the Epson 3800 for 5 years and the printer produced outstanding results. Then, I had a print head failure and decided to upgrade to the 3880 which is essentially the same machine with a vivid magenta and some technical refinements added. When installing the machine I did encounter some dirt/packing material on the print head which required a power cleaning to break it loose. Then the machine worked perfectly. I reprinted some files previously done on the 3800 and determined that the addition of the vivid magenta did produce a better color balanced print. The ICC profiles included with the driver are very good, especially with the Ultra Premium Photo Paper Luster which I prefer. I should add that manufacture support with any printer should be a strong consideration when deciding ... on a product. In this regard, Epson shines and my experience when trying to resolve the installation problem was outstanding with Epson technical support. Print time is reasonable with both 8X10 and 17X22 prints. I have used other manufacturers printers with RIP's but the 3880 is much easier to use with perhaps better results. I can strongly recommend the 3880 printer to anyone who has a need for a wide format machine. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Without all the techno talk, I will just say that it took little time to set the printer up and the 1st full size print was incredible. Beautiful color and detail. All others have been excellent.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: A lot of bang for the buck
Item.Review: I have been an amateur photographer since 1973. I work mostly in the field of landscape and wildlife photography. The advent of digital photography has made it so much easier to produce fine art quality photographic prints. I have been using the little Epson Photo Stylus Photo 820 for several years but recently upgraded to this Epson Stylus Pro 3880 in order to print using larger format. I am very impressed with the vibrant colors and deep blacks one would not get with a cheaper off the shelf photo printer. It is so nice to be able to print on fine art quality paper and have complete control over the entire workflow process. I use a Canon EOS 7d and work both in Lightroom 3 and Photoshop CS5. I do my printing mostly from Lightroom and have found it fairly easy to select the correct p ... rofiles for this 3880. I am having a blast working with this printer and would highly recommend it to others. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: [...] I enjoyed peeling off the blue security tape from almost every surface.Epson finally built a large format printer that prints on all paper surfaces with less ink thirst and waste from gloss/matte black ink flush. I've had this printer 3 months. I've printed 50 17x22 prints, plus many 13x19's and the tanks are still half full.Colors are true, blacks & greys are neutral unless I tweak them myself. Construction is not flimsy -- it's a solid tool.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I sell my photography in several local Galleries and I love the quality of the prints I get using the Epson 3880 printer. It allows me to print greeting cards as well as photos up to 17 inches wide. It fits quite nicely on a table next to my computer and is easy to use. I have had no problems with it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use the printer primarily for black and white large format photography. Using Epson Exhibition Fiber, this printer gives me the closest to wet darkroom quality results of anything I've see. While I have some issues with the default driver settings, a little tweaking makes it a useful tool for anyone's print-making purposes. The one fault I find is the amount of ink it consumes in switching between black inks. If Epson could work that out, they would not just have a first class product...they'd have the perfect product.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I purchased this unit to replace a stylus photo r2400. I do my own photo printing for art fairs and galleries. The larger format and increased quality of prints allows me to offer a better product to my customers. The larger ink tanks (over the 2400) make life much easier. Print quality is visibly better than I had before. My only wish is that the unit was capable of using roll paper, although the available sheet options are extensive.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am a photo hobbyist. Bought this printer simply because simply because a [...] and the reduced cost (by 40-45 percent) of inks compared to my Epson R2400. First thing I noticed is a better printing of the blacks. I calibrated this printer to my monitor with the Colormunki and got a perfect print the first time. Great Black and White prints. I am looking forward to a great life with this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Amazingly sharp and highly detailed photo prints from high IQ Tiff image files! Great photo art results on either photo paper or canvas. Prints 17 wide yet fits on a printer stand or one side of a large desk/workstation.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: As a long time Epson user, all the way up to the 44 9600, this little 17x22 printer is an excellent workhorse for the most common size print runs. As a photographer who used to be an owner/operator of an old fashioned chemical lab with .1 degree temperature controls, nitrogen burst systems, roller transport print processors, and the stench of chemistry, I can finally say the chemical darkroom has received the final nails in its coffin. The Stylus Pro 3880 works famously in color and black and white, but this is where the software is a bit quirky, at least in Mac OS X. The printer does not always remember what mode it is in, particularly on a new job about to be printed for the first time. Basically, this means the ink wasteful matte-photo black change cycle happens a bit too often. Ink ... is the backbone of the printer industry, and such behavior guarantees good business for Epson. That said, the prints are comparable to the lab, and actually better when you consider the levels of pre-print manipulation which can be applied which are beyond the pale of ANYTHING in the chemical lab. The speed at 1440 ppi is much faster than previous printers I still have, like the 2200 and even the four color 3000. After one or two prints, I put up my 9600 for sale, knowing the 9880 was in store, near term. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: 4 out of 5 *'s Only thing missing is a roll paper option. But then again, this is more than enough printer for most needs and I've been completely satisfied. Especially for the price, this is THE printer to buy...the only place to go from here is big, real big. Big like the Epson 9900.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: After 20 years in the darkrooom making B&W prints I got my first digital camera. I had some prints made by a service but mainly used it to put photos on a web site and blog. The Epson 3880 came highly recommended by [...] but I had never used a printer. When the 3880 came from B&H* it was a week before I set it up and when I tried to install the software it wouldn't work. That meant I must descend into techno-torture, the tech support line. Imagine my surprise when a few seconds after dialing I had a real live human on the line. He stuck with me and solved the problem which involved restarting the computer several times and eventually downloading what I needed. In addition he spent a lot of time teaching me how to actually make a print. A few minutes later I made my first print, as ... good as any I got from the service. Have since made more prints which I really like.*B&H, if your a photographer and visiting New York City you will fine their store a worthwhile stop. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Easy setup and the prints are vivid and of great detail. I am really pleased with my decision to purchase the 3880. Compact enough for my small work place. No regrets.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am a photo enthusiast. Image quality is very important to me. This printer blows me away. It is everything you have read in reviews. I have had numerous printers (Epson and others) over the years. Epson does it right again and again. There is now a new bar set. Highly recommend.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this printer for my landscape prints and its wide gamut and reasonable speed are real plusses for me. It was easy to set up and start printing in about 45 minutes. After several weeks I don't have any negatives so far.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Printer came on time, packaged with excellent protection and was a breeze to set up. I utilize the 3880 pro with my MAC tower/photoshop and aperture, as well as a variety of plug ins, and the calibration and changes for media are a piece of cake. Black and white prints have superb range and the color, inclusive of the reds are spot on and amazing. I have total control at my finger tips. (Epson has a number of profiles for different color settings and media profiles and it is important to play around with them to get the best results...or to achieve whatever affect you are looking for.) I do love the fact that I don't have to change the ink cartridges every time I want to go back and forth from matte to glossy media. I chose this model due to it's size, price point and quality ...I w ... anted the compact footprint without sacrificing quality ...coupled with archival pigment inks, you can't beat this model. It doesn't have a roll feed, but I didn't want or need it as I utilize the printer for a lot of manual feed art prints with unique and unusual media. One thing it doesn't have that I would like is retractable pizza wheels...but the next step up in printers that does is a significant jump in price....and most are huge. This printer serves it's purpose for 80% of my printing...it is limited to 17 in width so I send those out, but I didn't want to take up the space to accommodate those prints anyway, nor would it have penciled out for me to shell out the money for the wider format model. Bottom line, I am really happy with the investment in this printer and it is servicing my needs well with high quality prints on a variety of substrates. You can't go wrong for the value/money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I replaced my Epson R-2400 printer (which was excellent) with the Stylus Pro 3880 because I wanted to be able to print 16 X 20 prints. I have had the new printer for a couple of weeks now, and I am blown away with the great prints I am getting. Set-up was very easy following the very good documentation that came with the printer, and only took about an hour. The colors are very clear, accurate and vibrant. Black and White prints are absolutely awesome! All in all, I am very pleased with my printer up grade. I like the large ink cartridges, even though they are quite expensive.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: You have two choices. You can let the printer manage color or you can ask the software (Photoshop/Lightroom etc) to manage BUT NOT BOTH. Be sure to turn one of them off otherwise you get false colors. Properly managed the colors are superb. I like the on-board switching from matte to regular black ink so no more handling cartridges.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Just received and started using Epson 3880. Eassy to install and begin using. Initial B&W images were crisp and superb quality --- could not tell difference between similar printed in darkroom. Began printing in color and will need to work at syncing screen images with print output. The learning curve is on.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am very impressed with this printer so far. I have had it about 2 weeks now and I can't believe how easy it is to use. Right out of the box the images are incredible quality. I haven't explored much of the color syncing but I honestly haven't had much need to. The prints are clear, vivid and intense. Prints equally well in color and b&w. When I first ordered this printer I was a little apprehensive as I'm not a technical wizard by any means. I can take the picture, but digital printing is way beyond me. This system has made it very easy and straightforward. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I am an amateur photographer who has been doing prints for several years. I just moved up from the Epson Stylus 2200. There is no comparison between the two in print quality. The hookup was simple and the instructions for print were as simple as could be expected. My only concern is the cost of ink which could be a major factor in terms of purchase. As for now, I am completely satisfied.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I would love to get the results that other reviewers have seen; however, I cannot even begin since the front door will not close, and the ink door will not close. I have an Epson Photo R800 which is a better built machine, but the 3880 is cheaply made and I am stuck. If there was a negative star, I would use it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Superb prints with control over color pr
Item.Review: I use the printer for both exhibition prints and normal work. On exhibition papers such as Silverrag, prints have noticeably better resolution and more subtle tonal gradations than excellent printers such as the Epson r2880. The only annoying feature is the back feeder, which is cranky, often registering skewed paper. However, the top feeder can be used for exhibition weight paper without any apparent problems.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Wish I had bought it sooner!
Item.Review: It makes better prints than online or local printers- once I discovered the settings that work for me. I have Photoshop CS5 and I initially used the printer profile for my papaer suggested by the manual. The prints turned out darker and with lower contrast. Something made me select Adobe RGB (1998) for the printer profile and Absolute Colormetric for the rendering intent and suddenly my prints started coming out very close to what I was seeing on my monitor- even though the monitor hadn't been calbrated. I would buy this printer again and I would suggest to any of my friends in the market for a large format printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I've only had it for a week now, however I'm completely satisfied -- actually pleasantly surprised at the results. I'm using ir primarily for B&W with Photoshop controlling the colors/process and using NIK Silver Efexx 2.0 for the conversion -- definitely Gallery Quality prints.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this to make prints to sell online. So far, so good although I haven't experimented with the different sizes of paper. The prints on Luster paper are incredible! My only compliant is that the borderless printing only works on preset sizes. You can't add a custom size of paper and print boderlessly on it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I bought this printer for home use. Its not too big or small for the space I'm in. Very sleek and professional looking if you haven't seen it in person. I chose this printer because of the quality, the price range i had to work with and the fact that i am already familiar as I have used the same printers at school to work on my photography classes. It took about a half hour to set up and do a test print. Follow directions when setting up this printer, it makes it easier. I have had this printer about 2 weeks, no problems yet.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Epson should provide better installation instructions in it's manual regarding connecting to a network. Everyone can't be a network engineer. The epson help line claims they do not support this sort of installation. So after installing the printer directly through a USB connection, the prints so far are coming out with good color reproduction.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Upgraded from an R1800. General print quality is great and color match is much better than the 1800. Larger ink cartridges and cheaper ink as well. Good upgrade.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast Print Time; Easy To Use; Low Ink Consumption; Easy To Set Up; Durable construction; Reliable
I use this printer to deliver fantastic quality prints to my clients on a regular basis. It is fast, reliable, and with fast delivery of ink from Adorama, my life is much better with Epson and Adorama!

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I use this to print photos for local exhibits and the like. The convenience of having the printer in my home is amazing and the quality is great. The colour is good and likewise the black and whites, which are often as hard if not harder to get rivet, have been great, i got a great deal on this with ink included.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Very pleased with my new Epson 3880 photo printer. Fine Art B&W photos look great. No complaints. Waiting for my $300 rebate to flow from Epson, then I will be extra happy.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Reliable; Easy Setup; Compact Design; Easy To Use; Durable construction
Suprise, this printer will actually print on larger then 17 x 22 inch paper, I routinely make prints w/ image size 15 x 24 inches on 17 x 25 inch paper. Also I can print on not only regular inkjet paper but I can go out and get regular water color paper at art supply stores and print on that. However Ink does cost and with 9 cartridges at 60 each, it can add up. But the cartridges do lats so it is not so bad. Of course it might be a good idea to have another printer for routine work one that does not use such expensive inks.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: So far so good. The difficult part was getting it out of all the wrapping. I use ColorSync and so far have had prints that match my monitor pretty well. It is a bit larger than I expected. It runs quietly and smoothly and the prints are excellent if you use the right profiles. When I monkey with the Photoshop settings things can go haywire but that is my problem not the printer's. I plan to prepare a gallery show with 16x20 prints.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Moving up from a worn out HP B9180, I should have made the move years ago. Most of my work is printed on Hahnemuhle fine art papers, but this printer does beautiful images on Breathing Color Lyve canvas, Canson Aquarelle, Epson Ultra Smooth Fine Art, and the Black and White prints on Epson Ultra Premium Luster are breathtaking. The HP could never pull that off for me.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: The best printer I have ever owned
Item.Review: I was using and still have an Epson R2880. I recently recieved my 3880 from B&H. The 2880 has been collecting dust ever since. The quality of the prints is excellent. The paper feeding issues I sometimes experienced with the 2880 are nowhere to be found on the 3880. I primarily print B&W images from scanned negatives, and the Advanced B&W mode and the ability to pick between warm, cool, and neutral toned prints is fantastic. Detail is amazing as well. I love this printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
I'm a newbie to printing my own photography and have owned the R3000 for 3 months. To others who may be contemplating buying one, don't be discouraged by some of the comments here about poor quality printing.
The most important thing to learn about printing your own photography is this message from Adobe Lightroom:
"If you choose a custom printer color profile in Lightroom, make sure color management is turned off in the printer driver software. Otherwise, your photos will be color converted twice, and the colors might not print as you expect. See your printer’s documentation for instructions on turning off colour management in the driver software."
I bought three books from Amazon specifically relating to printing on the Epson R3000, or Epson printers generally. I rec ... ommend the same "learn as you go", or to save ink, read first and then start your printing.
The payoff for the investment is the quality of the printing you will be doing. I have already entered one of my picture (13 x 19) in a silent auction art show, and will be putting a display of 12 photos in a nearby university. Thinking you may be a good photographer is one thing, but the Epson prints can give you the confidence that you really are.
One more thing: Save your matt printing for one session to avoid ink waste by going back and forth from glossy to matt.
I highly recommend this printer. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Perfect prints from the first print! Easy setup and great ink usage! If you have the space and you don't need roll paper then this is the printer for you... great color matched prints immediately..this is a big upgrade from my previous Epson 2200 printer.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Large Format Inkje
Item.Review: Product used to reproduce high quality images thatg I photograph. Subject matter ranges from family, experiences, scenery etc. Having researched these printers for almost one year, I settled on the 3880 having seen other's results, and after actually trying an HP 9180 which was poorly-made and unreliable. My prints so far have turned out excellent, especially B&W. I do not have enough experience yet with ink cartridge longevity, but it seems the printer gives a wide enough range of choices to manage this issue effectively. Having made the transition from darkroom to office studio I am finding that one must learn the basics of color conversion from monitor to print. It is a challenge but one that a printer like this makes easier. Set up was fast and simple. I have both a USB connec ... tion to Mac and a network ethernet connection to PC. Both set up quickly and flawlessly. Biggest problem thjis printer now has is operator error. I hope this helps anyone considering this machine expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: this is my second epson priter and this pro 3880 is my best one so far. the output of this printer qaulity is beautiful compare to my epson 1400 before. if you really want your photo to look pro then buy this one....you going to love it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Out of the box stunning prints.
Item.Review: The combination of the Epson 3880 and my 17inch Mac Book Pro are yielding stunning prints right out of the box at set up. Professional prints at a consumer level price.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: Having owned a 3800 prior to this, I can say that the printer has been tweaked in certain ways beyond the change to vivid magenta ink. The printer is noticeably quieter during printing, and just seems tighter overall.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: OK - had a chance to mess with the printer a little more - discovered the front cover wouldn't remain closed because the front manual feed slot wasn't fully retracted, and was pressing against the front cover. Once I ensured the front feed slot was fully recessed - problem solved. Tried to print in landscape by placing paper in printer length-wise - doesn't work that way. Once I figured out the paper goes in face up, and narrow side down - problem solved. Still working with the paper profiles - prints are a tad darker than I'd like, but overall, I'm getting more comfortable with the printer, and can now rate it @ 4 stars.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: I just had my 3880 Delivered Friday, Sunday and I printed my first photo taken with an old 8 mp Canon S5 IS and all I can say is WOW! I can't wait to see what my new Canon 60D will produce. Unpacking and installation was a breeze, although heavy and large with a lot of tape in and on it. I downloaded the new drivers for my Mac (Lion) and I was off and running. Reccomendation: Order a dust cover, nothing ruins a printer faster than dust. I just revived another printer I ran off of my Mac that had huge dust buildup and I definitely wouldn't want that to happen to my 3880.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy To Setup
I use for photo production only - flexible for setup with multiple photo sources - Included software and add-ins allows for both printer and outside software control of images. Not restricted on paper sourcing- Epson brand paper in combination with this printer produces very high quality prints, but you are not restricted and may use specialty papers from other sources.VA

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.ReviewTitle: Finally found the perfect photo printer
Item.Review: I have been printing 13 x 19 pictures for several years. I recently moved up to the 3880 in order to print 16 x 20's and have found the quality of this printer to be more than imagined. Speed and color quality are amazing. Best pictures I have printed in the past 20 years.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: awesome printer. great quality of print. you can not use roll of paper on it but you are able to print 17x37 a have tested and works great. printed 16x24 and look great. if you can afford the go for it.

Item.Item: Epson Stylus Pro 3880 Color Ink-jet printer - 120 sheets
Item.Review: The quality prints are fabulous! A bit slower print per page but only because it needs to take it's time to do a great job. Con - printer is a bit heavy and inks are very expensive.
